title: Members of French charity Emmaüs struggle to condemn founder accused of abuse
summary: Members of the community, who were often welcomed when they were most vulnerable, have expressed their shock, anger and doubts following revelations of sexual assaults committed by the famous priest Abbé Pierre.

title: Thierry Breton's resignation marks the end of a stormy relationship with Ursula von der Leyen
summary: The European commissioner's repeated criticism of the Commission president was the deciding factor in his reappointment. Emmanuel Macron eventually decided to appoint someone close to him, the outgoing foreign affairs minister, Stéphane Séjourné.

title: Main accused in French mass rape due back in court on Tuesday
summary: Accused of drugging his wife to both rape her and enable others to rape her, Dominique Pelicot has been excused from court for most of last week.

title: 'From this side of the Atlantic, Trump can seem like an anomaly, but he has taken the measure of a profound American anxiety'
summary: Le Monde's former correspondent in Washington, Gilles Paris, answered readers' questions after an apparent second assassination attempt targeted Trump on Sunday.

title: Myanmar floods death toll jumps to 226 with 77 missing: state TV
summary: Typhoon Yagi swept across northern Vietnam, Laos, Thailand and Myanmar more than a week ago with powerful winds and an enormous amount of rain, triggering floods and landslides that have killed more than 500 people, according to official figures.

title: Three Iranian actresses forced into exile after starring in  'The Seed of the Sacred Fig,' which won at Cannes
summary: Niousha Akhshi, Mahsa Rostami and Setareh Maleki were forced to flee Iran, leaving their families behind after secretly acting in director Mohammad Rasoulof's latest film, which won the Jury's Special Prize at Cannes. They now live in Berlin.

title: Barcelona property owners organize against tourist rental ban
summary: An association of rental property owners is threatening the Catalan government with multiple legal actions against a new law that has enabled Barcelona's Socialist mayor to ban Airbnb and similar platforms by the end of 2028.

title: Hamas chief says ready for 'long war' in Gaza
summary: Israel's retaliatory military offensive after the October 7 attack on Southern Israel that sparked the war has killed at least 41,226 people in Gaza, according to the Hamas-run territory's health ministry, which does not provide a breakdown of civilian and militant deaths.

title: Russian war film to be screened in Toronto despite 'threats'
summary: The Toronto International Film Festival, which ended on Sunday, announced last week it was pulling 'Russians at War' due to threats, calling the decision an 'unprecedented move.' The controversial film is now set to be shown on Tuesday.

title: In Libya, the reconstruction of Derna: 'A windfall for the Haftar clan'
summary: A year ago, the city was ravaged by deadly floods. Today, authorities in the east of the country are highlighting reconstruction that has been carried out, but they are taking care not to detail the cost.

title: Trump blames Biden and Harris 'rhetoric' for assassination attempts
summary: The former president rapidly politicized the second apparent assassination attempt, claiming that speeches by Joe Biden and Kamala Harris were 'causing me to be shot at, when I am the one who is going to save the country.'

title: UK PM Starmer praises Italy's Meloni for reducing illegal migration
summary: Keir Starmer's visit came a day after eigh people died in the latest migrant shipwreck in the Channel.

title: Shogun: The Japanese-American series that made Emmy Awards history
summary: After being dominated for several years by 'Succession' and 'Ted Lasso', this year's awards honored a number of robust series, as well as some more surprising choices.

title: Suspect in Trump apparent assassination attempt charged with gun crimes
summary: Fifty-eight-year-old Ryan Wesley Routh, who was arrested on Sunday after an alleged abortive bid to shoot the former president at his West Palm Beach golf course, is expected to face further charges at a later arraignment.

title: Storm Boris unleashes massive flooding across central Europe
summary: Poland and Romania have been among the hardest hit countries after Storm Boris unleashed huge amounts of rain.

title: Syria's youth is tempted to leave
summary: 'Syrian Diaires' (Part 2/7): Economic stagnation and the fear of conscription have led most Syrian students, a truly lost generation, to look for ways to leave their country.

title: Manchester City's 'trial of the century' opens in England
summary: The Mancunian club is facing 115 charges before a Premier League committee for breaching UEFA's financial fair play rules between 2009 and 2018.

title: France nominates foreign minister Stéphane Séjourné for EU Commission
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron has proposed outgoing Foreign Affairs Minister Stéphane Séjourné as a European Commissioner following the resignation of the EU Commissioner for Internal Market Thierry Breton.

title: France's ambiguous stance on deep strikes in Russia
summary: Ukrainians want to disrupt Russian logistics at the rear of the front line. France remains in the background of these discussions against a backdrop of political turbulence in Paris.

title: Parents and police officers are now being held accountable for US school shootings
summary: Increasingly, when teenagers commit massacres, their parents are arrested. Furthermore, lapses on the part of law enforcement are no longer being overlooked.

title: Firefighters battling flames around Brazil's capital
summary: Authorities warned that things were likely to get worse in ultra-dry conditions after 140 days without rain in Brasilia. The number of fires in Brazil so far this month (57,312) has already exceeded the total for September 2023 in its entirety, according to satellite data from the INPE research institute.
